intro: Marlothiella, commonly known as the dwarf lichen, is a genus of lichens that belongs to the family Parmeliaceae. These organisms are symbiotic, consisting of a fungal component and a photosynthetic partner, typically a green alga or cyanobacterium. Marlothiella species are often found growing on rock surfaces, tree bark, or soil in arid and semi-arid environments. They are characterized by their crustose or foliose growth forms and can exhibit a range of colors from green to yellowish or brown. Due to their slow growth and sensitivity to environmental changes, they are considered indicators of ecosystem health.
